intro: Aronicum scorpioides var. pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean aronicum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer. The Pyrenean aronicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
